item.title: New vaccine gives fresh hope to save the koalas
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Queensland medical professionals to take industrial action as negotiations with state government stall
item.description: About 2,000 radiographers, pharmacists and radiation therapists will take industrial action from Friday.

item.title: Reddit and Kick added to child social media ban
item.description: Reddit and Kick will be included in the world-first social media ban for children under 16, which begins next month.

item.title: ASIC shone a light on private lending and did not like what it saw
item.description: The corporate regulator is threatening Australia's nascent private lending industry with tighter regulation if it does not see a significant lift in standards.

item.title: David Beckham receives knighthood from King Charles at Windsor, with wife to be known as Lady Beckham
item.description: World-famous footballer David Beckham is handed the honour, for services to sport and charity, at a ceremony at Windsor Castle.

item.title: Five people sentenced to death in China for their role in Myanmar scam centres
item.description: A Shenzhen court has sentenced five people to death for their involvement in a violent criminal gang with fraud operations in Myanmar, Chinese state media says.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani favourite to become New York mayor as polls close in US elections
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, who looks set to become the Big Apple's first Muslim mayor, has declared that it is "time for a new day in our politics" as voters headed to the polls in America's largest city.

item.title: Some homebuyers feel left behind one month into Australian government's 5pc deposit scheme
item.description: The federal government's expanded 5 per cent deposit scheme is intended to be a leg-up into the housing market but some first home buyers struggling to secure a loan or a deposit are worried they will be left behind.

item.title: Marinus Link project payouts cheered by some Tasmanian farmers, but others refuse to budge
item.description: The fate of the contentious Marinus Link project lies in the hands of hundreds of Tasmanian landowners, some of whom are welcoming the financial compensation. For others, it's a different story.

item.title: US Federal Reserve pumps cash into Wall Street as banking system shows signs of stress
item.description: Analysts say recent Wall Street activity shows pockets of global money markets are coming under strain. It has got some people worried the world could be heading towards another global credit crunch.

item.title: Administrators called in for Tahmoor coal owner amid $29m in unpaid royalties
item.description: The future of a NSW coal mine remains unclear after its holding company entered administration, with the mine owing more than $100 million in outstanding debt, including almost $30 million in unpaid royalties.

item.title: Does intermittent fasting dull your mental edge? We crunched the data for the best advice
item.description: Intermittent fasting can have health benefits, but does being hungry affect our cognitive abilities? Here's what all the evidence tells us.

item.title: November's 'beaver' full moon will be the closest supermoon of the year. Here's how to see it
item.description: The difference from other full moons won't be all that noticeable to the naked eye, but you can enhance the viewing experience if you pick the right time and vantage point.

item.title: Workplace culture reviewed at Toowoomba Hospital amid maternity leadership turnover
item.description: Thousands of babies are born at the Toowoomba Base Hospital each year, but some women say they are scared to give birth there.

item.title: Judge awards $500,000 to Joanna Scott in Ben Aulich-founded companies share dispute
item.description: The Federal Court has found a Canberra woman was unfairly stripped of the value of her shares in two companies founded by former lawyer Ben Aulich, awarding her $500,000 in compensation.

item.title: Residents warned to be aware of 'disaster chasers' after severe storms. Here's what to look out for
item.description: After being smashed by giant hail, south-east Queensland residents are being warned to be aware.

item.title: Documents reveal Bureau of Meteorology's new website could cost $78m — or as much as $150m
item.description: Tender documents and sources show the Bureau of Meteorology's new website may have cost between $78m and $150m — much higher than initially reported.

item.title: Western Sydney hospital report finds 'avoidable' errors in lead up to Deaf man's death
item.description: Bruce Drabsch's daughter Melinda Dagger, who was travelling to hospital to be with her ailing father, was phoned by a doctor and asked to inform her mother her husband of more than six decades had died, because no Auslan interpreter was provided.

item.title: NRL to crack down on poaching contracted stars in wake of Lachlan Galvin saga
item.description: NRL clubs are set to be put on notice and told they can no longer publicly declare interest in a player at a rival team unless the target is off contract.

item.title: Federal politics: Question Time erupts as treasurer accuses Ted O'Brien of 'egregious lies' — as it happened
item.description: Jim Chalmers accuses Ted O'Brien of spreading "egregious lies" about government spending, leading to protests from the opposition. Take a look back at the day's coverage.

item.title: CSIRO koala population estimates triple, but conservationists cast doubt on figures
item.description: Koala advocates and logging supporters have seized on the release of data showing koala population estimates tripled in the past three years.

item.title: Key Queensland inland highways left without EV chargers
item.description: The Queensland government says schemes to help grow its electric charger network have been "fully contracted" with "no additional funding committed", leaving it to towns, roadhouses and accommodation providers to fill the gap.

item.title: Karenia cristata species source of toxins in SA's algal bloom, scientists believe
item.description: Scientists believe they have identified the species responsible for the toxins in South Australia's marine algal bloom that has killed millions of aquatic animals.

item.title: Liz Heggaton lobbies federal parliament for better prostate treatment after husband's death
item.description: Liz Heggaton has become an "accidental advocate" for prostate cancer after her husband Craig took his own life while receiving treatment for the disease.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios to face Aryna Sabalenka in Battle of the Sexes exhibition in Dubai
item.description: Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka are to star in the latest man-vs-woman tennis match, with Kyrgios following several notable Australians in doing so.

item.title: Thunderstorms, hail, damaging winds mark WA weather forecast for much of the week
item.description: A severe weather system is expected to bring thunderstorms, damaging winds and hail to much of Western Australia this week — with 50mm of rain or more possible for some areas through Thursday night.

item.title: GrainCorp class action settlement fails with dispute set to head back to court
item.description: A class action stemming from a long-standing dispute over alleged noise and odour pollution from a GrainCorp factory in Victoria will head back to court after the parties failed to agree on a settlement.

item.title: Police charge husband with murder over the 1991 death of Whittlesea woman Melinda Freeman
item.description: Police say 63-year-old Craig Freeman has been charged with murder over the death of Whittlesea woman Melinda Freeman in 1991.

item.title: Robert Taylor, ex-lead guitarist of NZ rock band Dragon, dies aged 74
item.description: Robert Taylor, the former lead guitarist of the New Zealand band behind hits like April Sun in Cuba and Are you old Enough?, has died aged 74.

item.title: Synergy lodges applications for 'divisive' wind farm on WA's south coast
item.description: A proposed 20-turbine wind farm at Scott River in WA's South West reaches a development milestone with developers and power provider Synergy lodging formal applications.

item.title: Helen Garner wins Baillie Gifford Prize for collected diaries, How to End a Story
item.description: After being featured in Dua Lipa's book club and the SATC spin-off, Helen Garner has won the Baillie Gifford Prize for non-fiction for her collected diaries, How to End a Story.

item.title: Bell Bay Aluminium and Hydro Tasmania 'buy time' with short-term power deal
item.description: Bell Bay Aluminium and Hydro Tasmania reach an in-principle power agreement, after the smelter last month told staff the company's future in northern Tasmania was at "significant risk".

item.title: Sussan Ley confronts leadership coup speculation head-on
item.description: The opposition leader has sought to hose down speculation she will soon be toppled, saying she is "completely confident" she will still be in the job at the end of the year.

item.title: Dawesville man accused of grooming, sexually assaulting girls faces 59 charges
item.description: WA Police charge a 34-year-old man with dozens more child sex abuse charges, including sexually assaulting girls he groomed online, after an initial investigation earlier this year.

item.title: US proposes Gaza stabilisation force until 2027 in pitch to United Nations
item.description: An international stabilisation force implemented in Gaza would exist for at least two years if approved by a United Nations resolution, according to a draft text circulated by the United States.

item.title: Mount Gambier's Valley Lake welcomes 200 disc golfers for The Eruption
item.description: A volcanic eruption 6,000 years ago created the Valley Lake and the conditions for one of Australia's most popular disc golf courses.

item.title: Older Australians face long wait to be assessed for aged care
item.description: Families and insiders say the system to assess people for aged care is in crisis, with 116,000 people on the waiting list. Once approved, they join the queue to get a home care package, which stands at more than 120,000.

item.title: Little penguins re-establish breeding grounds on NSW far south coast
item.description: A re-establishing little penguin colony, once locally extinct, is finding its feet on the NSW far south coast.

item.title: Max Dowman, 15-year-old Arsenal winger, becomes Champions League's youngest player
item.description: At 15 years and 308 days old, Arsenal winger Max Dowman comes on as a sub against Slavia Prague to become the youngest player in Champions League history.

item.title: Australia names its squad for the first Ashes Test in Perth, Jake Weatherald potential opener
item.description: Australia has named its squad for the first Ashes Test, but is no closer to knowing who will open the batting in Perth on November 21.

item.title: Murchison shires, residents complain about water quality despite significant upgrades
item.description: Stinging eyes, dead plants and a "white" film over appliances are among water complaints in Western Australia's Murchison.

item.title: Ballina shipwreck mystery close to being solved by analysis of single piece of wood
item.description: The identity of a shipwreck that was exposed in northern New South Wales by Cyclone Alfred has been narrowed down to just 13 vessels.

item.title: Man rescued near Mount Buller after being caught in unexpected November snow dump
item.description: Police say that a 20-year-old man who was caught in a blizzard near Mount Buller overnight has been safely rescued.

item.title: Behind the News presenter Jack Evans designs T-shirts to share Indigenous language on screen
item.description: Every week ABC Behind the News presenter Jack Evans designs a T-shirt featuring a word from his mob's language and shares it with the show's audience.

item.title: Race discrimination commissioner questions AFL's commitment to fighting racism
item.description: Australia's race discrimination commissioner says the AFL is falling far short of its responsibility to combat "horrific racism" aimed at its players.

item.title: Father and son die after being stung by swarm of 'murder hornets' during Laos holiday
item.description: An American teacher and his teenage son die after being stung more than 100 times by a swarm of hornets while climbing down a tree after zip-lining at a resort in Laos.

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology wave buoy in SA offline again despite nine-month repair
item.description: Despite a new "specialist mooring" part that took nearly a year to import and install, the Cape du Couedic wave buoy is offline again.

item.title: Two men charged with murder over gangland assassination of John Versace in Condell Park
item.description: The pair have been charged after the cleanskin tradie was killed outside his family home in May.

item.title: Man's misdiagnosis with cancer after pathology error 'linked with his death', coroner finds
item.description: The consequences of a contaminated biopsy sample, which led to a man being wrongly diagnosed with lung cancer and having part of his lung unnecessarily removed, were "profound", a coroner has found.

item.title: Experts share tiny home warning as interest from young people soars
item.description: Public interest in tiny homes has skyrocketed in recent years, but experts warn they come with their own problems.

item.title: AFLW rising talent Sophie McKay comes from a famous football family. Yet she almost didn't play
item.description: Despite coming from a family with a strong pedigree for football, one of the AFLW's best new talents almost gave it up. Now, she is enjoying putting on a show.

item.title: Former Zimbabwe cricket captain Sean Williams reveals 'drug addiction' during probe over mystery withdrawal
item.description: Sean Williams's cricket career with Zimbabwe comes to an end as a probe into his withdrawal from a T20 World Cup qualification tournament reveals his battle.

item.title: SA Liberals to phase out stamp duty by 2041 if they win next election
item.description: South Australia's Liberal party says it will phase out stamp duty by 2041, if elected in March, but the premier has labelled the promise as "one of the most reckless, dangerous policy announcements" he has ever seen.

item.title: Local screen industry welcomes proposed Australian content obligation for streaming services
item.description: On Tuesday, Arts Minister Tony Burke proposed a requirement for 10 per cent of streaming services' local expenditure to be spent on Australian film and TV. Here's what the industry thinks.

item.title: Coalition housing spokesman says first home buyer house prices should fall
item.description: Taking a position he acknowledges his colleagues may not always want to admit, the Coalition's housing spokesman says prices for "entry-level" properties need to come down.

item.title: Moving to the outback gave me courage to do things I never dreamed of
item.description: Being in the middle of nowhere, you learn what really matters. You find yourself experiencing things with unbridled passion, without shame or second-guessing.

item.title: Seven people arrested in counter-terrorism sting in regional Queensland
item.description: Seven people have been arrested in a months-long counter-terrorism sting in regional Queensland.

item.title: Bundaberg council takes roadside produce seller to court twice
item.description: Raymond Aitkin has been selling seasonal fruit by the side of the road for more than 20 years, but he has found himself before the court twice this year and claims the council is singling him out.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani's win in New York City will send a message to Donald Trump
item.description: After using a Trump-style tactic in his campaign, Zohran Mamdani probably now has the US president's begrudging respect — as well as his attention.

item.title: US 2025 election winners: Virginia and New Jersey get new governors, Proposition 50 passes in California
item.description: Millions of Americans have flocked to polling booths around the US, casting their votes for governors, mayors and ballot measures.

item.title: Nearly 8 million hectares burnt during Northern Territory's hottest October on record
item.description: Last month nearly 8 million hectares were burnt in the Northern Territory, an area bigger than the entire state of Tasmania.

item.title: Twice proves there is an audience thirsty for K-pop in Australia
item.description: Next stop Melbourne for multinational K-pop group Twice after Sydney concerts are lapped up by excited fans.

item.title: New Zealand coach Stacey Jones calls for greater scrutiny of warm-ups as NRL continues probe into Eliesa Katoa incident
item.description: New Zealand coach Stacey Jones says his thoughts are with Eliesa Katoa as he prepares his side to take on Samoa in the final of the Pacific Championships.

item.title: Logan City Council commissions independent review into flood map modelling after receiving thousands of complaints
item.description: A south-east Queensland council has commissioned an independent review of its flood zone mapping modelling.

item.title: Convicted mushroom murderer Erin Patterson outlines her reasons to appeal
item.description: Triple-murderer Erin Patterson is fighting to have her conviction quashed, claiming there was a "substantial miscarriage of justice" during her trial.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Perth Football League's suspension of Osborne Park FC a 'line in the sand' moment, says league boss
item.description: The boss of the Perth Football League urges clubs to treat the suspension of Osborne Park FC over an end-of-season costume stunt as a "line in the sand moment" for their culture.

item.title: One in 10 homes bought using first home buyers guarantee in October
item.description: About one in 10 homes sold last month were bought by Australians using Labor's expanded 5 per cent deposit scheme to enter the market for the first time.

item.title: Danielle North leaves Ambulance Victoria executive role after parliamentary inquiry
item.description: Executive director Danielle North has departed Ambulance Victoria, after the service said she may have misled a parliamentary committee about her knowledge of gatherings during COVID lockdowns.

item.title: China lifts some tariffs on US farm goods but soybeans remain costly
item.description: China has ended retaliatory tariffs on a range of US agricultural products but will maintain 10 per cent tariffs on all US goods in response to President Donald Trump's "Liberation Day" duties.

item.title: Evidence concludes in murder trial of man who fatally stabbed his wife in NT remote community
item.description: Evidence has concluded in the three-day murder trial of a man who fatally stabbed his wife following an argument in a Northern Territory remote community.

item.title: Japan deploys troops to the northern town of Kazuno to trap bears after record wave of attacks and deaths
item.description: In September, the government relaxed gun rules to make it easier for hunters to shoot bears in urban areas.

item.title: Five injured after driver rams car into pedestrians and cyclists in France
item.description: A prosecutor has said a 35-year-old man deliberately rammed his car into pedestrians and cyclists on the French island of Oleron.

item.title: Ukraine and Russia locked in intense clash over key strategic city of Pokrovsk
item.description: Moscow says it is making advances in the key city, which it says would allow Russian forces to claim more territory in Ukraine's eastern Donbas region.

item.title: Man arrested after groping Mexican president Claudia Sheinbaum
item.description: Claudia Sheinbaum says her government will review the country's laws on sexual harassment, saying she has filed a complaint to stand up for other Mexican women who are not in positions of power.

item.title: Sussan Ley's net zero problem won't only impact the Coalition
item.description: If, as expected, the net zero target is abandoned, the long delay in reaching this point will leave the Liberals looking like they've capitulated once again to the Nationals.

item.title: Launceston General Hospital air-conditioning upgrades won't be complete for summer
item.description: Exhaust fans from patient bathrooms at Launceston General Hospital are being used to instead suck in cold air from the air-conditioned corridors, documents obtained under Right to Information laws show, as summer approaches again without crucial cooling upgrades being complete.

item.title: Artificial intelligence, therapy and education: How AI is reshaping our lives whether we like it or not
item.description: We asked readers if they had thoughts or concerns about the rise of AI. This is what they told us.

item.title: AI is changing jobs fast — and Australians are beginning to wonder how they’ll stay relevant
item.description: AI's rapid uptake in Australian workplaces has many workers asking how they can stay relevant.

item.title: Secret WA government report casts doubt on claims domestic gas will help other countries in energy transition
item.description: A secret report undermines the WA government's claim that domestic gas production is helping the rest of the world decarbonise, while the state's own greenhouse gas emissions rise.

item.title: Builders face daunting mission to boost housing supply despite 'green shoots'
item.description: The building industry is reporting a lift in approvals and new home sales, but says planning delays and skilled labour shortages are holding back construction, amid calls to unlock higher density development.

item.title: Sydney Festival 2026 line-up includes Hot Chip, The Crown star Khalid Abdalla and a The Smiths cabaret
item.description: The 50th anniversary of Sydney Festival — and the first from new artistic director Kris Nelson — features a mix of Australian and international artists taking over spaces across the city.

item.title: Nearly 10,000 SA childcare incidents reported resulted in 'no action', FOI documents show
item.description: South Australia's childcare regulator has cancelled the registration of just one provider in recent years, while nearly 10,000 reported incidents have resulted in no further action, FOI documents obtained by the ABC have revealed.

item.title: Free buses and child care part of Zohran Mamdani's planned socialist overhaul of New York City
item.description: New York City's newly elected mayor Zohran Mamdani is promising to make people's lives cheaper, but even some of his supporters are sceptical about whether he can deliver.

item.title: Tasmanian town of Longford urges authorities to find source of mystery stink
item.description: Authorities say $38 million has been spent trying to stop this town from stinking, but residents say they are still being forced indoors, put off meals and subjected to humiliating jokes.

item.title: Latrobe Valley manufacturer pivots from coal to wind as region braces for energy shift
item.description: As major offshore wind developers wait for an auction process in Victoria to begin, work is already underway to ensure Gippsland's long energy legacy translates into new opportunities.

item.title: What is the new species detected in SA's algal bloom?
item.description: New research awaiting peer review has provided a few revelations about the make-up of South Australia's algal bloom, with a new predominant species — Karenia cristata — identified by scientists. Here's what we know so far.

item.title: Doctors at Northern Beaches Hospital issue warning over loss of private beds
item.description: Medical staff at Northern Beaches Hospital say a potential loss of private beds could mean less expertise, fewer services and more travel for patients.

item.title: Queensland breeder says she 'would have apologised' if buyers told her of dogs' health issues
item.description: A Queensland dog breeder has been accused of selling puppies with broken teeth, gunky eyes, lice and hookworms, years after being fined for failing to care for animals.

item.title: Young men rejecting 'cookie-cutter' masculinity but many still feel pressure to act tough, study finds
item.description: Many young men are rejecting the "Herculean cookie-cutter mould" of masculinity, but a new report warns boys who hold rigid views are suffering.

item.title: Eddie Obeid, Ian Macdonald and Moses Obeid appeal convictions over corrupt coal licence deal in High Court
item.description: Three men at the centre of one of NSW's biggest corruption cases are fighting to overturn their jail terms over a $30 million coal deal tied to a family property.

item.title: Venus Williams's Auckland Classic entry sparks hope of Australian Open appearance
item.description: Venus Williams is to start her 33rd straight season in women's tennis at the Auckland Classic, with another Australian Open appearance for the 45-year-old now a possibility.

item.title: Owner of seven cats modifies home to keep them away from wildlife
item.description: Tim Bestwick has modified his northern NSW so his beloved seven cats do not spoil his other passion, bird watching.

item.title: Jess Jonassen keen for Australia recall as Brisbane Heat skipper nears WBBL milestone
item.description: Jess Jonassen is not holding her breath for an Australian recall, but the Brisbane Heat captain believes she can still contribute at the international level.

item.title: Build townhouses to lower rents and house prices, Grattan Institute report says
item.description: Rents and house prices would be 12 per cent lower than otherwise within a decade if all capital cities are rezoned to allow three-storey buildings, a report finds.

item.title: Federal politics: PM unveils official portrait of Bob Katter — as it happened
item.description: Anthony Albanese unveils an official portrait of Bob Katter to commemorate his more than 50 years of service to Queensland and federal parliaments.

item.title: Image of stranded humpback whale wins Ocean Photographer of the Year award
item.description: Craig Parry is used to capturing beautiful photographs of the ocean at its best, but this heartbreaking image won him a prestigious Ocean Photographer of the Year award.

item.title: Doctor heard about $600k Julia Creek job from truck-driving brother, not from viral campaign
item.description: Julia Creek welcomes a rural Australian GP after running a viral job campaign and receiving 95 applications from across the globe.

item.title: Family of Australian man accused of cocaine smuggling speak ahead of possible Bali death sentence
item.description: The sister of Australian man Lamar Ahchee, who has been on trial on drug charges in Bali, describes the moment she heard the news of his arrest.

item.title: NAB shares down as bank's profit comes in below expectations, James Hardie shares plunge -- as it happened
item.description: NAB shares have dropped after reporting a dip in net profit, as the bank's boss flags housing as Australia's biggest challenge. But the big move of the day came from James Hardie, with its stock plunging 13%.

item.title: Millions are going unpaid and hungry as the US federal government shutdown breaks records
item.description: The ongoing federal government shutdown has surpassed the record for the longest in US history, leaving thousands of workers without pay. Here are some of the key numbers.

item.title: Isaah Yeo returns as Kangaroos look for Rugby League Ashes clean sweep in Leeds
item.description: Isaah Yeo is back after concussion but, with the Ashes series already won, Kangaroos coach Kevin Walters has still opted against changes for the last Test.

item.title: When is the Brazilian F1 grand prix Australian time and how to watch Oscar Piastri in action
item.description: Oscar Piastri enters this weekend's Formula 1 racing, trailing his teammate by one point in the drivers' championship. Here is how to follow the Formula 1 São Paulo Grand Prix.

item.title: UPS plane death toll rises, authorities say engine fell off before crash
item.description: Louisville Mayor Craig Greenberg has confirmed the death toll has risen to at least 12, with several people still missing.

item.title: Who could benefit most from free power hours under Labor's proposed Solar Sharer scheme?
item.description: The federal government wants to introduce a retail offering that gives people in certain states free electricity in the middle of the day, but one expert fears there could be hidden costs.

item.title: Spud King expands business with $14 million South West orchard investment
item.description: WA's "Spud King" Tony Galati has expanded his empire with a $14 million bid to purchase two South West orchards which will see his business move into apples and avocados.

item.title: A huge fireball moments after the crash in Kentucky
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Microsoft to refund customers for 365 subscription price hike after ACCC action
item.description: Microsoft apologises to customers and says it will refund them, after the consumer watchdog alleged the tech giant misled about 2.7 million Australians over subscription costs so they would remain on more expensive plans.

item.title: Man suffers stab wounds during citizens' arrest of knife-wielding man in Melbourne's CBD
item.description: Two bystanders have helped detain a man who was allegedly seen wielding a knife and behaving erratically in Melbourne's CBD.

item.title: Four bodies found after central Queensland house fire
item.description: Queensland's Premier David Crisafulli says the community of Emerald will be in shock after this morning's fire.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios aims to play Australian Open after 'miracle' knee recovery
item.description: A revitalised Nick Kyrgios has revealed his shock plans to make a summer comeback and hopefully play the Australian Open in January.

item.title: Australia captain Pat Cummins says he is still trying to keep the second Ashes Test as a 'live option'
item.description: Pat Cummins says his return to bowling has gone better than expected, with Australia's captain still eyeing off a return for the second Ashes Test.

item.title: Sydney Swans AFLW part ways with inaugural coach Scott Gowans after missing finals
item.description: The Sydney Swans are in need of a new AFLW head coach after parting ways with Scott Gowans.

item.title: 'Conscious consumers' embrace of Australian goat meat presents a quality challenge
item.description: Producers will have to balance consistent supply with the ethical expectations of America's "conscious consumers" as international demand for wild-caught rangeland goat meat surges.

item.title: Sydney Trains worker dead after cherry picker crashes into rail overpass in Lithgow
item.description: A cherry picker passenger has died after the vehicle crashed into a bridge in the NSW Central West, causing it to collapse.

item.title: WA government to buy St John of God Mount Lawley Hospital, fund major hospital upgrades
item.description: A major upgrade of the Perth Convention and Exhibition Centre is axed to help pay for three major Perth and Mandurah hospital projects under a $1.5 billion health infrastructure fund.

item.title: Theatre-maker Lamine Sonko explores Senegalese cosmology in his latest show, Guewel
item.description: When Lamine Sonko arrived in Australia 20 years ago, audiences didn't understand his work. Now he is sharing the rituals and rhythms of Senegal with a willing crowd.

item.title: NSW Health to review regional hospital security after Tamworth guard bitten
item.description: The New South Wales health minister says he intends to review security powers at regional hospitals after four guards were injured at Tamworth.

item.title: Court of Appeal spares underworld figure Tony Mokbel extra jail time over drug scheme
item.description: Victoria's highest court rules that Mokbel is no longer "a serious drug offender" and won't be sent back to prison over a methamphetamine trafficking racket.

item.title: Man suffers stab wounds during citizen's arrest in Melbourne's CBD
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sydney man Danny Zayat found guilty of murdering Tatiana Dokhotaru in Liverpool apartment
item.description: Danny Zayat has been found guilty of murdering his ex-partner Tatiana Dokhotaru after a heated argument inside her Liverpool apartment two years ago.

item.title: Greg Lynn's lawyers challenge 32-year sentence on day two of High Country killer's appeal
item.description: The High Country killer's legal team says the 32-year prison sentence Lynn was handed for the murder of Carol Clay was "manifestly excessive".

item.title: Healthcare professionals accused of negligence in Diego Maradona's death to face fresh trial
item.description: The seven healthcare professionals accused of negligence in the death of Argentine soccer great Diego Maradona are facing a new trial after a mistrial last year.

item.title: Prime minister confident social media ban will work and will empower parents
item.description: Anthony Albanese says he is confident Australia's social media age limit will be a success when it begins next month.

item.title: The potential use of fracking continues to divide West Australians, particularly in the Kimberley
item.description: As WA's EPA assesses a proposal to drill and frack in the Kimberley's Canning Basin, groups call for WA Labor to enforce a ban across the state.

item.title: Jake Weatherald's route to the Australian Ashes Test squad a path less trodden
item.description: Jake Weatherald could become the latest player to represent Australia in the Ashes following a superb 18 months in the Sheffield Shield. But his path to the Test squad has not been conventional.

item.title: Man charged with murder and coercive control after Claire Austin's death in Randwick unit
item.description: The 44-year-old is charged almost seven months after Claire Austin's death in Randwick.

item.title: High-speed rail business case linking Sydney and Newcastle supported by government assessment body
item.description: The business case for high-speed rail between Sydney and Newcastle identifies four initial station locations for a one-hour journey.

item.title: Anthony Albanese confident under-16 social media ban will succeed
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Prince William joins Kylie Minogue, Shawn Mendes for green-carpeted Earthshot Prize awards in Rio de Janeiro
item.description: Prince William has joined Kylie Minogue and Shawn Mendes, along with a swag of world leaders and celebrities, for the annual Earthshot Prize awards in Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Zak Brown says McLaren will not prioritise Oscar Piastri or Lando Norris for F1 title
item.description: McLaren's boss says he would rather Red Bull's Max Verstappen win the Formula 1 drivers' championship than prefer one of his racers over the other.

item.title: RePoly defends Moss Vale plastic recycling project amid court appeal
item.description: RePoly accuses a Southern Highlands community group of spreading misinformation about its proposed plastic recycling plant as a campaign against the project is launched.

item.title: Taylor Swift sings about 'eldest daughter syndrome', but is it real?
item.description: Jess King says being the firstborn child in her family brought a weight of responsibility and she still struggles with feelings that she's "not doing enough".

item.title: Tasmanian budget 2025 shows lower forecast state debt, few new savings measures
item.description: Tasmanian Treasurer Eric Abetz has vowed to take "decisive action" to rein in the ballooning debt, but the "interim" state budget contains few major initiatives.

item.title: Cassowary wandering 150km from home in Queensland's Gulf Savannah baffles residents
item.description: Queensland's department of environment says it has no plans to relocate a cassowary spotted roaming the dry Gulf Savannah.

item.title: Hail and heavy rain batter West Australia's Great Southern and Wheatbelt region
item.description: Severe weather has swept through large parts of the Great Southern and Wheatbelt, causing significant damage to crops during the critical harvest period.

item.title: World Club Challenge returns as NRL premiers Brisbane Broncos schedule clash with Super League champions Hull KR
item.description: Brisbane will take on Hull Kingston Rovers in the World Club Challenge in late February with the NRL premiers confirming the return of the showpiece event.

item.title: Port Adelaide coach Josh Carr denies Warren Tredrea has been kicked out of club
item.description: Warren Tredrea's premiership teammate Josh Carr says he will always remain a Port Adelaide legend despite being sacked from the club's board last week.

item.title: Adelaide artist Peter 'Jungle' Phillips dies aged 69 in his gallery home
item.description: Known for his generosity and a spectacular art gallery home filled with colourful works, Peter "Jungle" Phillips is remembered by those who loved him dearly.

item.title: David Wayne Jenkins's family describe heartbreak during sentencing submissions
item.description: Family members of murder victim David Wayne Jenkins describe the anguish they felt when hearing about his death during sentencing submissions at Launceston's Supreme Court.

item.title: Katter's present comes early, Coalition stalls on net zero New Year's resolution
item.description: "There will be a corner of this Parliament House that is forever Bob Katter," the prime minister said this week.

item.title: Man charged with murder over fatal vehicle strike during Timber Creek brawl
item.description: Police have charged a 21-year-old man with murder for allegedly killing another man by driving a car into him during a brawl in a remote Northern Territory town.

item.title: Walgett councillor charged over alleged assault of female bowling club worker
item.description: A Walgett Shire councillor stands down while investigations continue into an alleged assault at a bowling club.

item.title: The art of price baiting — how real estate agents lure buyers to auction
item.description: To advertise a property for $1 million, knowing it must sell above $1.3 million, is illegal. It is called underquoting, and in NSW it is rife, according to data analysis.

item.title: Boyfriend welcomes coronial findings about Simone Strobel's murder 20 years ago
item.description: The findings of a coronial inquest into the death of German backpacker Simone Strobel in Lismore in 2005 have been delivered.

item.title: Parliamentary inquiry probes experiences of children in high-control religious groups
item.description: A Victorian parliament probe into the impacts of cults and organised fringe groups hears lived experience testimony from two women who grew up in high-control religious groups.

item.title: Serial rapist Graham Kay pleads guilty to sexually touching Sydney schoolgirl without consent
item.description: Convicted rapist Graham Kay will remain in custody after sexually touching a 16-year-old girl in the Sydney CBD while on a strict supervision order.

item.title: Murdered doctor's family confronts killer during plea hearings
item.description: The convicted killer, who cannot be named, showed no emotion as Ashley Gordon's family members confronted him one by one during a plea hearing at court.

item.title: NT man Steven John found guilty of wife's murder in unanimous jury verdict
item.description: A jury has unanimously found Steven John guilty of murdering his wife when he stabbed her in the back following a drunken argument in 2023.

item.title: Federal government approves expansion of Victoria's largest gold mine near Bendigo
item.description: Fosterville Gold Mine in central Victoria is approved to continue running until 2045 despite concerns from neighbours and environmental advocates.

item.title: Australia's de facto online gambling regulator stops accepting gifts from betting companies, for now
item.description: The announcement comes six months after the ABC first reported the Northern Territory Racing and Wagering Commission chair had accepted corporate hospitality from bookmakers.

item.title: Liberals recalled to parliament to thrash out net zero problem
item.description: Liberal MPs will return to parliament on Wednesday to thrash out a position on the party's net zero commitment ahead of a joint party room meeting with the Nationals next Sunday.

item.title: Five feared trapped after structure collapse at power plant in South Korea
item.description: The rescue operation is ongoing, with four people pulled from the rubble so far, a fire official says.

item.title: Canberra teenager behind bars over detailed plans for public attacks, possessing violent extremist material
item.description: A 17-year-old Canberra boy is behind bars after shocking allegations he developed detailed plans for public attacks and had equipment to create a bomb in his bedroom.

item.title: Male nurse charged with raping two elderly women at Greenslopes hospital
item.description: Police allege the 41-year-old committed the offences against two women in their 80s in 2020 and 2024 at a hospital in Brisbane's south.

item.title: Anti-corruption commission watchdog inquiring into NACC chief Paul Brereton
item.description: The inspector of the National Anti-Corruption Commission is inquiring into the agency's head, Paul Brereton, in relation to several complaints including from a former employee.

item.title: How Zohran Mamdani's triumph in New York is making waves around the world
item.description: The blistering rise of New York City's new mayor, Zohran Mamdani, has captured global attention. So what's going on and what does his win say about the American political climate?

item.title: Kangaroos not offended Hawthorn players missed Jasmine Garner's guard of honour after 100th AFLW game
item.description: Hawthorn players were noticeably absent from the guard of honour for North star Jasmine Garner after her 100th AFLW game, but the reigning champs are not too fussed about it.

item.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: India beat Australia in fourth T20I by 48 runs on Gold Coast, lead series 2-1
item.description: Australia lost 9-52 as India's spinners took control in a 48-run win in the fourth T20 international on the Gold Coast.

item.title: Sena needed surgery, but she couldn't understand her doctors
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: NT Police Force announces anti-racism action plan in bid to drive cultural change
item.description: The Northern Territory Police Force has released its first anti-racism strategy for staff, following years of headlines about racist attitudes that have dogged the organisation.

item.title: As Russian drone incursions rattle Europe, Poland and Romania deploy a new defensive system
item.description: The United States-built Merops system can identify drones and close in on them, using artificial intelligence to navigate.

item.title: Australia's $4 billion illicit tobacco trade has become one of the nation's most violent criminal markets
item.description: Authorities stress the $4 billion figure is conservative, as it does not include illegal vapes and e-cigarettes.

item.title: German police investigate swastikas drawn in human blood
item.description: The Nazi symbol was smeared dozens of times on cars, letter boxes and building facades, with tests confirming they were daubed in human blood.

item.title: Typhoon Kalmaegi brings destructive winds and heavy rains to Vietnam
item.description: Typhoon Kalmaegi has lashed Vietnam with fierce winds and torrential rains as it made landfall after leaving at least 114 people dead and dozens missing in the Philippines.

item.title: Louvre managers prioritised art over upgrading security in years before heist, report says
item.description: France's highest auditor says the theft of $157 million worth of jewels was a "deafening alarm bell" for the world-renowned Parisian museum.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi will not contest next US midterm elections, ending storied career
item.description: Ms Pelosi was the first woman to serve as US Speaker of the House of Representatives, and her decision will bring to an end a political career spanning four decades.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor summoned by US Congressional panel over Epstein ties
item.description: A US congressional panel has summoned the former British prince Andrew Mountbatten Windsor for questioning over his ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Emergency services personnel raise the alarm over poor mobile service in central Tasmania
item.description: Police and volunteer ambulance officers have told a community meeting they struggle to connect with people during emergencies due to poor 4G access in central Tasmania.

item.title: Inaction on 1.5C climate change target a 'moral failure', says UN Secretary-General at COP30
item.description: Missing from the line-up at the key summit in Brazil are the leaders of four of the world's five most-polluting economies — China, the United States, India and Russia.

item.title: Tasmanian Liberals won't want to take too slow a path back to financial stability
item.description: For all the talk about avoiding slashing and burning, the Tasmanian Liberals will not want to take too slow a path back to financial stability, writes Adam Langenberg.

item.title: Australia's 'no fail' submarine mission set for shake-up as admiral in charge exits
item.description: Vice Admiral Jonathan Mead's retirement will come just a year before the first US nuclear-powered submarine is due to be deployed to Western Australia in 2027 under the AUKUS agreement.

item.title: SA's ICAC 'busier than ever' despite watered down powers
item.description: South Australia's Independent Commissioner Against Corruption (ICAC) Emma Townsend has taken over an anti-corruption commission described by her predecessor as the "weakest integrity agency in Australia". Does she agree?

item.title: 2025 among three warmest years on record, according to World Meteorological Organization
item.description: According to the report, the past 11 years, 2015 to 2025 have been the 11 warmest individual years in the 176-year observational record.

item.title: Fashion boss Shmuel Tal to face trial over alleged violent sexual offences in Byron Bay
item.description: A millionaire fashion boss is banned from entering Byron Bay's party precinct as he awaits trial over violent sexual offences.

item.title: Emerald community grieving after four people die in central Queensland house fire
item.description: Investigators are trying to piece together the cause of a blaze in central Queensland that has left a family devastated and residents in shock.

item.title: Carter Gordon named at flyhalf for Wallabies look to avenge Italy defeat
item.description: The code-hopping Carter Gordon will be back in the starting No.10 shirt for the Wallabies against Italy in Udine as Tane Edmed reverts to the bench.

item.title: Alleged killers travelled from NSW for fatal hit on Melbourne man Athan Boursinos, police say
item.description: Police believe two men travelled to Melbourne from NSW to carry out the fatal shooting of 21-year-old Athan Boursinos in July.

item.title: Andrew Barr concedes his succession looms but says his experience is still needed
item.description: ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr acknowledges that leadership of the Labor party will "need to transition to a new generation" but argues stability is vital as Labor governs without the Greens.

item.title: Calls for more translators in Australian medical industry to help those falling behind
item.description: Sena Husic left a war-zone in Bosnia 30 years ago for Australia, and went on to suffer debilitating spinal pain because of the language barrier she struggled to overcome. Now she's finally received treatment, but there a calls for translators to bridge the gap.

item.title: Former RAH electrician to receive $2.26 million asbestos cancer damages claim
item.description: An electrician diagnosed with a rare asbestos-related cancer has been awarded a $2.26 million payout for exposure to toxic dust and fibres while working for various employers, including at the old Royal Adelaide Hospital.

item.title: Hundreds of Queensland babies may have missed vital newborn blood screening tests
item.description: The ABC can reveal that in July last year, Queensland Health department became aware of "inconsistencies" in records of the newborn blood spot screening program.

item.title: Typhoon Kalmaegi makes landfall in Vietnam
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Muswellbrook bans dongas at renewable energy and construction project sites
item.description: An Upper Hunter council is banning donga-style temporary work camps and demanding that developers build permanent, reusable housing.

item.title: Queenslanders warned about 'disaster chasers' targeting storm-hit homeowners
item.description: When three men turned up on Geoff Wilson's doorstep offering to check his roof for damage he took them up on it. But a requirement that the repairs must be done by a builder of their choice put him on alert.

item.title: Dashcam video captures moment of plane explosion
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Net zero division a test for Speakman
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Coalition climate turmoil is spreading to NSW when Mark Speakman can least afford it
item.description: While Sussan Ley is pulling out all stops to survive the so-called "killing season" before Christmas, the threats to Mark Speakman's leadership are perhaps not as clear.

item.title: Alex de Minaur learns ATP Finals fate as Carlos Alcaraz, Novak Djokovic await
item.description: Australian hope Alex de Minaur must get past world No.2 Carlos Alcaraz and 24-time grand slam winner Novak Djokovic to progress at the ATP Finals in Turin.

item.title: Israel strikes several areas in southern Lebanon, says it targeted Hezbollah weapons storage
item.description: The Israeli military carries out air strikes on southern Lebanon after issuing evacuation orders for several locations, saying it targeted weapons storage facilities for Hezbollah.

item.title: From PTSD to panic attacks, Australians are finding comfort in artificial intelligence, but experts urge caution
item.description: Artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT are embedded in modern life, with some Australians using them to help work through PTSD and toxic work environments.

item.title: These charts show the effect of migration on Australia's housing story
item.description: The role of migration is one of the most contentious elements to the housing debate. So what does the evidence show?

item.title: NFL player Marshawn Kneeland of Dallas Cowboys dead aged 24
item.description: The NFL is in mourning after the tragic and sudden loss of Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland, who was just 24.

item.title: Steven Miles says there isn't enough focus on early intervention programs for young people
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Steven Miles not drawn on whether future Labor government would keep adult crime, adult time laws
item.description: Former premier Steven Miles says Queenslanders have told him the issues of crime and community safety motivated them to switch their vote to the LNP at the 2024 poll.

item.title: Federal politics live: Greens say Labor's environment bill has 'big holes'
item.description: Greens senator Sarah Hanson-Young says her party is a long way from supporting Labor's environment reform bill which passed the lower house of parliament yesterday. Follow live.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: A supermoon, a famous bathroom and last horse over the line at the Melbourne Cup
item.description: There has been a lot going on in the headlines this week — were you paying attention?

item.title: Fears IDF's 'Yellow Line' splitting Gaza in two
item.description: A small sense of normalcy has returned in some areas of Gaza, but other parts remain under Israeli military control, fuelling concerns the strip is being divided.

item.title: Markets live updates: Tesla shareholders vote on Elon Musk's trillion-dollar pay deal
item.description: Tesla holds its annual general meeting in Texas, as Elon Musk seeks the highest ever CEO compensation package. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.
